javadoc:
Class to manage multiple linked lists of int indexes. Users can add indexes
 to a list, remove indexes from a list, remove all indexes from a list, and
 retrieve all indexes within a given list.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: numLists
params.comment: - The initial number of lists to be managed.

params.name: capacity
params.comment:
- The current size of the pool of possible indexes.  All indexes
  begin on the free list.

methods.name: add
methods.comment:
Allocates a new index resource and adds it to the front of the linked list
 indexed by listID.

params.name: listID
params.comment: the id of the list to add to.

methods.name: append
methods.comment:
Allocates a new index resource and adds it to the end of the linked list
 indexed by listID.

params.name: listID
params.comment: the id of the list to add to.

methods.name: remove
methods.comment: Remove the index resource from the linked list indexed by listID.

params.name: listID
params.comment: the id of the list from which to removed the value at index.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index of the value to be removed from the specified list.

methods.javadoc:
Removes all indexes from the specified list.
@param listID the list to be emptied.
methods.name: removeAll
methods.comment: Removes all indexes from the specified list.

methods.javadoc: Computes the next size that should be used to grow the index capacity.
methods.name: getNewCapacity
methods.comment: Computes the next size that should be used to grow the index capacity.

methods.javadoc: Returns the current number of used index resources.
methods.name: getSize
methods.comment: Returns the current number of used index resources.

methods.javadoc: Returns the number of linked list being managed.
methods.name: getNumLists
methods.comment: Returns the number of linked list being managed.

methods.name: next
methods.comment:
Returns the next index resource that follows the given index in a linked list.
 The index should be an index that is in some linked list.  Otherwise, the
 results are undefined( probably give you the next index on the free list )

params.name: index
params.comment: the index to search after for the next index.

methods.name: first
methods.comment: Returns the first index resource on the linked list indexed by listID.

methods.name: growCapacity

params.name: newCapacity
params.comment:
the new number of resource indexes to manage.  if this number
 is smaller than the current number of resource indexes, then nothing changes.

methods.name: growNumLists
methods.comment: Increases the number of managed linked lists.

params.name: newListSize
params.comment:
the new number of linked lists.  If this number is
 smaller than the current number of linked lists, then nothing changes.

methods.javadoc: Removes all indexes from all lists.
methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Removes all indexes from all lists.

methods.name: getListSize
methods.comment: Returns the number of indexes in the specified list.

params.name: listID
params.comment: the id of the list from which to get the number of indexes.

name: IntListIndexer
comment:
Class to manage multiple linked lists of int indexes. Users can add indexes
 to a list, remove indexes from a list, remove all indexes from a list, and
 retrieve all indexes within a given list.
